sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Israel bans all foreign nationals from entering country as Omicron cases rise.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Another 13 cases tested at Schiphol Airport, Amsterdam.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In a fresh bid to tackle the rising coronavirus infections, the Swiss must take to the polls again to decide on new restrictive measures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Not an easy step, but a necessary one.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Those were the words of Israeli Prime Minister Naftali Bennett, as Israel announced they will temporarily be banning all foreign nationals from entering the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The decision was made amid concerns of the new Omicron coronavirus variant, which appears to be more rampant and contagious than all previous COVID-19 strains.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Passengers at the Ben Giron airport had mixed views about the announcement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: I arrived from two days stay at Istanbul.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: My original plan was to stay for three days vacation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But because of the new Israeli decision government, I cut my vacation at Istanbul and came back early.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I'm not too nervous about what's going on.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I assume that I'm vaccinated, I had COVID already, so I think everything should be fine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile in Britain, they too are concerned about the new Omicron variant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Boris Johnson announced that face masks will once again be mandatory in shops and public transport, as well as mandatory PCR tests for all travellers arriving into the UK.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The moment we learned about Omicron and the potential threat it poses, as well as mandatory PCR tests for all travellers arriving into the UK.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The moment we learned about Omicron and the potential threat it poses, we didn't hesitate to act. We've taken swift action, I think in a proportionate way, because the strategy of this is to buy time to give our scientists time to assess this variant, which is still a lot of significant uncertainty.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: That uncertainty is echoed in the Netherlands.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: 13 of the 61 people who tested positive for COVID-19 on Friday who came from South Africa are confirmed Omicron cases, health authorities confirmed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Swiss are taking to the polls again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: However, this isn't a parliamentary election.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This Sunday, the electorate will vote on the so-called COVID-19 law.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The nation must now decide on measures including a pandemic recovery package and the application of a COVID certificate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Like many countries on the block, this health pass will restrict the movement of the unvaccinated from March 2022.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Early voting data indicates a 75% voter turnout.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This is the second vote on the government's pandemic response.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The first was back in June with 60% approving an extension to the national restrictions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: That one was ratified in September.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: While the infection rate has soared in recent weeks, the federal government has decided against a lockdown.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Unlike its European neighbours, the independent nation is responding to the pandemic with a series of referendums.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Major parties and voters will back the coronavirus policy, as polls suggest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: However, the right-wing populist Swiss People's Party has criticised the certificate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This building, which has been burned to a cinder, was a petrol station and this one, a post office.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Efforts to tackle Covid-19 have sparked violent protests on the French Caribbean island of Martinique. However, four people were shot and a number of businesses destroyed when riots spiraled out of control on Saturday night. This woman says I expected them to break and enter but not to set fire to the gas station. Do you realize that? A gas station is a bomb.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, some 200 kilometers away in Pointe-de-Pitre, the capital of French overseas territory Guadeloupe, more than 2,000 people came out to rally against coronavirus measures. The COVID-19 pandemic is fueling long-standing tensions with the mainland.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: However, on Friday, SÃ©bastien Lecornu, Minister of Overseas Territories, said he was ready to discuss the autonomy of Guadeloupe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: This businessman says, we understand, we the people and even the elected officials, that we do not have much control here in Guadeloupe. In terms of decisions, we need to educate the Guadeloupian people so that they can learn what autonomy means.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Frustrations over the government's mishandling of a toxic pesticide, chlorocone, which was used to cultivate bananas on the island, continues to fuel suspicion of the COVID vaccine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Less than a third of the population have been inoculated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Hordes of Australian peacekeepers have arrived on the Solomon Islands.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This comes after a small protest in the capital of Honiora on Wednesday erupted into three days of looting and violent rioting. The charred remains of three people have been found. But the Australian Prime Minister says their goal is not to dictate policy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It is not for us to be interfering in their democracy. It's not for us to be interfering in how they resolve those issues. We are just simply there as a good family member to try and provide a stable and safe environment for the issues that are there in the Solomon Islands to be peacefully worked through.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Many islanders believe their government is corrupt. But while tensions are now at bay, the stability of these specific islands remains unclear as poverty and joblessness continues to rise.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Thousands of women in Rome on Saturday protested about violence against women.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It's part of the global 16 Days campaign with demonstrations against gender-based violence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Campaigners denounce what they consider to be an institutional policy hostile to females, the LGBTQIA community and those vulnerable to the economic, social and health crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: So far this year alone there have been 109 femicides.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: That's about one every 72 hours.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Actually even more.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And according to the latest data, there are 89 women who report crimes related to gender every 72 hours, actually even more.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And according to the latest data, there are 89 women who report crimes related to gender-based violence every day, from stalking to sharing private material online to beatings and a whole range of harassment at work or at home.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: So 89 every day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile in Turkey, the police broke up the women's rights march in Istanbul with tear gas and rubber bullets. The protesters were denouncing the recent rise in violence against women. According to an advocacy group called We Will Stop Femicide, 18 females were killed by men and 19 others found dead under suspicious circumstances just in the last month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: and 19 others found dead under suspicious circumstances just in the last month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The award-winning Spanish writer Almudena Grandes has died at the age of 61 at her home in Madrid.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: She'd had cancer for more than a year since September 2020.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Grandes was one of the most representative figures of Spanish literature.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Some of her works reflected her political commitment to feminism and her left-wing political struggle.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: More than 400 people rescued from the Mediterranean Sea have disembarked at Sicily.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: They were picked up by the NGO Sea Watch in seven different operations several days ago and have been waiting for a safe port.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: After arriving in Augusta Friday afternoon, the people remained on board until health checks were done, which delayed them going ashore by one day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Hundreds of Ukrainians gathered near the memory candle in Kiev to commemorate the victims of Holodomor. They reflected on the famine of 1932 to 1933 under the Stalinist Soviet Union, in which millions died from starvation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Sixteen countries consider it to be genocide.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Symbolic candles are always put on windowsills for a moment of silence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Rare amateur footage of a polar bear chasing a reindeer into the water and killing it could

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: be another stark indication of climate change.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: After the female polar bear drowns the male victim, she drags it ashore in a move which indicates a change of diet for bears in Norway's Svalbard archipelago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Seals are the main source of food for polar bears but as sea ice retreats it takes the seals away too. The incident is being seen as one of a series of observations that suggest polar bears are increasingly preying on land-based animals to make up for their limited access to their normal diet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Retreating sea ice leaves bears stranded on land for longer periods.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: So with fewer seals and a steadily rising reindeer population in Svalbard, it appears polar bears are being forced to change their eating habits.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But it's yet further evidence of changing climate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The snow has arrived to order and in abundance in South Tyrol for the opening of the Italian ski season.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Italian resorts didn't open at all last year because of Covid restrictions and for fans of the sport it's been a long wait.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: I've got shivers up and down my spine, says this skier, because we left the slopes on that famous day March 8th 2020, rushing to Rome because everything was going into lockdown.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It's taken nearly two years, so we're very happy and very emotional.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: In the Dolomiti Super Ski Resort, Covid passes are needed before you can obtain a ski pass.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The important thing is to use the weapons we have, says the resort vice president.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Get vaccinated, respect the rules, use the green pass with all its potential and I think by doing so we could potentially manage the season without a lockdown.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But we are all aware that it could happen." Masks are required when going up on chairlifts or cable cars, but not when skiing on the way back down.
